snippet: Shareholders are still concerned about slow spending and growing competition from smaller, nimble rivals.
abstract: Oracle says that overall revenue in third quarter rose 4 percent, to $9.31 billion, but news fails to satisfy investors looking for signs of sustained turnaround and its shares fall 3.5 percent in after-hours trading; shareholders are still concerned about slow spending and growing competition from its smaller, more nimble rivals.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders are still concerned about slow spending and growing competition from smaller, nimble rivals.

headline.main: Net Income at Oracle Rises, but Results Worry Investors
headline.print_headline: Net Income at Oracle Rises, but Results Worry Investors
